title: CC314 broken links can be fixed
content:
I just rediscovered CC314's interviews, and noticed [url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/interviews/geoffsims1.html]Geoff's interview[/url] has 2 broken links.
Using the Wayback Machine those can be fixed:
- [url=http://web.archive.org/web/19971211025637/http://www.lancs.ac.uk/ug/kaufman/keenpage.htm]Commander Keen (Unofficial) Home Page[/url]
- [url=http://web.archive.org/web/20000610001855/http://docker.com/~hillmanjr/keen/index.html]Commander Keen[/url]

(Also the interview's actual title is "Interview Index", and the actual index's title is actually "Interviews - Cerebral Cortex 314", which are confusing.)Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: CC314 broken links can be fixed
content:
Cheers, I've never seen those sites (and can't remember reading this interview either [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-embarrassed.gif[/img] ), too bad Wayback machine doesn't have much of the content featured on those sites.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: CC314 broken links can be fixed
content:
Yeah, its not very Keenspecific.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: CC314 broken links can be fixed
content:
KR, perhaps you missed the [url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/interviews.html]other interviews[/url] as well then.

I remember reading about the pen and pencil thing a looong time ago, and wondering what the guy was talking about. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
He's probably referring to Keen's walking sound.

Hmmm, one of those 2 sites is screwy.
The first time I got an "Error 550 (or something), unable to open directory" or something along those lines.
(It's a pop-up dialog box, and according to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_status_codes]Wikipedia[/url] 505 nor any other is status code is about that error, so I'm not sure what the fault is exactly.)
Anyway, after that, my Firefox told me I could send an error report and closed on me.
No problem after I retried right after that, but just now after opening those 2 sites Fx gave me the error again and hung on every link I tried to click.
Closing Fx completely didn't really close the session, so I had to force it closed.
Oh well!Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]
